intro: Bupleurum odontites var. fontanesii, commonly known as the Alpine Bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine layer of hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates.
